title: What are some of the best quotes from Bob Dylan? - Quora

response.answer_text: I am a huge Bob Dylan fan. I have a file on my computer were I collect quotes from Dylan. I do not claim to understand all of them, but find them compelling. So here they are : Advertising signs, Con you into thinking you're the one, That can do what's never been done.Ain't it just like the night to play tricks, When you're trying to be so quite.All my powers of expression and thoughts so sublime, Could never do you justice in reason or rhymeAnd it’s that ol’ sign on the cross, That worries meAnd there's no use in tryin', T' deal with the dyin', though I cannot explain that in lines.Anger and jealousy’s all that he sells usAre you so fast that you cannot see, that I must have solitude? When I am in the darkness, why do you intrude?As easy it was to tell black from white, It was all that easy to tell wrong from right.As he weeps to wicked birds of prey, Who pick up on his bread crumb sinsAt dawn my lover comes to me, And tells me of her dreams, With no attempts to shovel the glimpse, Into the ditch of what each one meansAt one time there was nothing wrong with me that you couldn't fixBankers' nieces seek perfection, Expecting all the gifts that wise men bring.Beggar man, beggar man, tell me no lie, is it a mystery that we live or a mystery that we die.Betrayed by a kiss, on a cool night of bliss, In the valley of the missing linkBusinessmen, they drink my wine, plowmen dig my earth, None of them along the line know what any of it is worth."But Eden is burning, either brace yourself for elimination, Or else your hearts must have the courage for the changing of the guardsBut I can't think for you, You'll have to decide, Whether Judas Iscariot, Had God on his side.But I feel nothing for their game, Where beauty goes unrecognized.But it grieves my heart, love, to see you tryin' to be a part of, a world that just don't exist.But the enemy I see, Wears a cloak of decency.But to remain as friends and make amends, You need the time and stay behind.Come on, give it to me, I'll keep it with mine.Don’t think of me and fantasize on what we never had, Be grateful for what we’ve shared together and be gladDon't criticize what you can't understand.Even Jesus would never, Forgive what you do.Everything I am saying, you could say just as goodFollow her down past the fountain where they lifted her veilFor every enemy I faced, The cause was there before we met, And for every cause I fought, I fought it full without regret or shame.For years they had me locked in a cage, Then they threw me onto the stageFunny, the things you have the hardest time parting with, are the things you need the least.Gentlemen, he said, I don’t need your organization, I’ve shined your shoes, I’ve moved your mountains and marked your cardsHe who is not busy being born, Is busy dying.Heart of mine go back home, You got no reason to wander, you got no reason to roamHorseplay and disease is killing me by degreesHow can today make up for yesterdayHunger pays a heavy price, To the falling gods of speed and steel.I asked for salvation, But they gave me a lethal dose.I can't help it if I'm lucky.I can't remember what it was, That I came here to forget.I couldn't tell her what my private thoughts were, But she had a way of finding them out.I count the years and I shed no tears, I'm blinded to what might have beenI dreamed I saw St. Augustine, Alive with fiery breath, And I dreamed I was amongst the ones, That put him out to death.I fought with my twin, that enemy within, 'Tel both of us fell by the way.I got a cravin' love for blazin' speed, I got a hopped up Mustang Ford, Jump into the wagon, love, Throw your panties overboardI got lost on the river, but I did not drownI know the reason, That you talk behind my back, I use to be among the crowd, You're in with.I laugh and I cry and I'm haunted by, Things I never meant nor wished to sayI love you dear, but how much longer can I keep singing this same old song.I once loved a woman, a child I'm told, I give her my heart but she wanted my soulI practice a faith that's been long abandoned, Ain't no altars on this long and lonesome roadI think we better talk this over, Maybe when we both get soberI walk across the bridge in the dismal light, Where all the cars are stripped between the gates of nightI was born here and I'll die here, against my willI was so much older then, I'm younger then that nowI went to sleep in Shreveport, woke up in Abilene and couldn't figure out why I was wanted in a town half way in betweenI wish for one moment you could stand in my shoes. And for that one moment I could be you. Then you could see what a drag it is to see you.I’m not there, I goneIf there is an original thought out there, I could use it right now.If you don't believe there's a price for this sweet paradise, Remind me to show you the scars.If you get close to her, kiss her once for me, I always have respected her for busting out and gettin' freeI'm going to spare the defeated, I'm going to speak to the crowd. I'm going to teach peace to the conquered, I'm going to tame the proudI'm lost in the haze, of your delicate ways.I'm not the one you want, babe, I'm not the one you needI'm singin' love's praises with sugar coated rhymeI'm the oldest son of a crazy manI'm too stubborn to be governed.I'm trying to love my neighbor and do good unto others, But oh, mother, things ain't going wellIn fourteenth months I only smiled once, but I didn't do it conciselyIn Jersey everything is legal as long as you don't get caughtIn the dime stores and bus stations, People talk of situations, Read books, repeat quotations, Draw conclusion on the wall.It ain't no use a-talking to me, It's just the same as talking to you.It’s getting harder and harder to be me.It's you and you only, I'm been thinking about, But you can't see in and it's hard lookin' outI've been conjuring up all these long dead souls from their crumblin' tombsJust when you thought you have lost everything, You find out there is more to loseLay, lady, lay, lay across my big brass bedLost time cannot be foundLot of things can get in the way, when you're tryin' to do what's rightMay you have a strong foundation, When the winds of changes shiftMeet me at the bottom, don't lag behind, Bring me my boots and shoes. You can hang back or fight your best on the front lineMore frailer than the flowers, these precious hours, That keep us so tightly boundMy bewildering brain, toils in vainMy clothes are wet, tight on my skin. Not as tight as the corner that I painted myself inMy hands are sweating, And we haven't even started yetMy mind weaves a symphony and tapestry of rhymeMyself, for what I did, I cannot be excused, The changes I was going through can't even be used,No, I do not feel that good, When I see the heart breaks you embrace.Now you’re standing there expectin' me, To remember somethin' you forgot.Now, I've always been the kind of a person that doesn't like to trespass, But sometimes you just find yourself over the line.One too many morning, and a thousand miles behindOnly one thing I did wrong, Stayed in Mississippi a day too longPatriotism is the last refuse of a scoundrelPlease see for me if her hair hangs long, If it rolls and flows all down her breast. Please see for me if her hair hangs long, That's the way I remember her best.Renegade priests and treacherous young witchesSeñor, señor, do you know where we’re headin’?Lincoln County Road or Armageddon?She may know what you need, But I know what you want.Since every pleasure's got an edge of pain. Pay for your ticket and don't complainSome things are too terrible to be trueSome young lazy slut has charmed away my brainSomething is happening here, But you don't know what it is, Do you Mister Jones.Stake my future on a hell of a pastStanding next to me in this lonely crowd, Is a man who swears he's not to blame. All day long I hear him shout so load, Crying out that he was framed.Stick with me baby, stick with me anyhow, Things should start to get interestin' right about nowStill I wish there was somethin’ you would do or say, To try and make me change my mind and stayStrange how people who suffer together have stronger connections, Then people who are most content.Stripped of all virtue as you crawl through the dirtTake me for a trip on your magic swirling ship.Tell me where it hurts and ,I'll tell you who to callThat god you have been paying to is going to give to you exactly what you have been wishing on someone elseThe answer my friend, Is blowin' in the wind.The empty rooms where her memory is protected, Where the angels' voices whisper to the souls of previous times.The louder they come, the harder they fallThe only thing we knew for sure about Henry Porter, Is that his name wasn't Henry Porter.The pump don't work, 'Cause the vandals took the handle.The truth was obscure, too profound and too pureThe vagabond at the door, Is wearing clothes you once wore.There are many among us who feel, That life is but a joke.They have some hungry women there, And man, they will make a mess out of you.They tell me that revenge is sweet, And from where they stand, I'm sure it is.They'll be no mercy for you once you've lostThis woman so crazy, I swear I ain't going to touch another one for yearsThrough the mad mystic hammering of the wild ripping hail, The sky cracked its poems in naked wonderToo much of nothing, Can drive a man insane.Twenty years of schooling and they put you on the day shiftWe kissed through the wild blazing night timeWell, I'm preaching peace and harmony, The blessing of tranquility, Yet I know when the time is right to strikeWhen you ain't got nothing, You've got nothing to lose.Y' always got to be prepared, but you never know for whatYet there's no one to beat you, No one to defeat you, Except the thoughts of yourself feeling bad.You always said people don't do what they believe in, They just do what's most convenient, then they repent.You can’t get to glory by the raising and the lowering of no flagYou don’t have to be afraid of looking into my face, We’ve done nothing to each other time will not eraseYou don't need a weather man, To know which way the wind blows.You gonna need my help, sweetheart’ You can’t make love all by yourselfYou know, I feel pretty good, But that ain't sayin' much.You might think me odd, If I tell you that I love you, Not for what you are, but for what you're not.You were right from your side, and I was right from mineYou will search, babe, At any cost, But how long, Can you search for what is not lost.Your conscience betrayed you when some tyrant waylaid you

Everyone of them words rang true….  "The songs are there. They exist by themselves, just waiting for someone to write them down. If I don't do it, someone else would"-New York, 1962 "The criminal drug situation takes place in suburban housewives' kitchens-the ones who get wiped out on alcohol every afternoon and then make supper. You can't blame them and you can't blame their husbands"-New York, 1965 "I'm a song and dance man"-San Francisco, December, 1965 "I have weak eyes. Try them for yourself. See the world as Bob Dylan sees it"-London, 1965 “I don’t even know what a drug is. I have never even seen a drug. I would not know what one looked like if I saw one”-Dylan's answer to the question “Do you take drugs yourself?”-Los Angeles, 1965 "Songs aren't going to save the world"-Los Angeles, 1965 "They certainly booed. I'll tell you that... They've done it a lot of other places. I mean they must be pretty rich to be able to go someplace and boo. I couldn't afford it if I was in their shoes"-San Francisco, 1965 "I've done more for Dylan Thomas than he's ever done for me"-New York, 1966 "Carelessness. I lost my one true love. I start drinking. First thing I know I'm in the card game. Then I'm in a crap game I work in the pool hall..."-Dylan’s answer to “What made you decide to go the rock ’n’ roll route?”-New York, 1966 "You can get sex anywhere. If you're looking for someone to love you, now that's different. I guess you have to stay in college for that"-New York, 1966 “The real magic of women is that throughout the ages, they've had to do all the work and yet they can have a sense of humour”-Playboy Magazine, 1978 “Politics and social trends don't really concern me. Left, right or middle – it's all just the same to me. I'm not sufficiently scored in politics to have a real view”-London, 1997  E/D

There are a lot of great ones in Chronicles. “I had very little in common with and knew even less about a generation that I was supposed to be the voice of. I’d left my hometown only ten years earlier, wasn’t vociferating the opinions of anybody.” “I really was never any more than what I was — a folk musician who gazed into the gray mist with tear-blinded eyes and made up songs that floated in a luminous haze. Now it had blown up in my face and was hanging over me. I wasn’t a preacher performing miracles. It would have driven anybody mad.” “Students trying to seize control of national universities, antiwar activist forcing bitter exchanges. Maoists, Marxists, Castroites — leftist kids who read Che Guevara instruction booklets were out to topple the economy.” “I was sick of the way my lyric had been extrapolated, their meanings subverted into polemics and that I had been anointed as the Big Bubba of Rebellion, High Priest of Protest, the Czar of Dissent, the Duke of Disobedience, Leader of the Freeloaders, Kaiser of Apostasy, Archbishop of Anarchy, the Big Cheese. What the hell are we talking about? Horrible titles any way you want to look at it. All code words for Outlaw.” “I felt like a piece of meat that someone had thrown to the dogs. The New York Times printed quacky interpretations of my songs. Esquire magazine put a four-faced monster on their cover, my face along with Malcom X’s, Kennedy’s and Castro’s. What the hell was that supposed to mean? It was like I was on the edge of the earth.” “I had all the technical theory I would need. My audience would stop being a shady army of faceless people. Of course, some of them would still only concentrate on the lyrics and they might be dismayed because of the two-beat strum they’d been used to for so long would now be off rhythm, refocused and rushing the songs into the heart of unimagined territory. But that’s okay, they could handle it.” (about Oh Mercy) “A song is like a dream, and you try to make it come true. They’re like strange countries that you have to enter.”  There are also great ones from interviews, particularly in the interviews from the mid-sixties. Unfortunately, I don’t have so many, but I can find some. “I won’t be able to talk to you [journalist] afterwards. I got nothing to say about these things I write. I mean, I just write them. I don’t have to say anything about them, I don’t write them for any reason, there’s no great message. I mean, if you wanna tell people that, go ahead and tell them, but I’m not gonna have to answer to it. And people are gonna think ‘what is Time magazine telling us?’, but you couldn’t care less about that either. You don’t know the people that read you.” “I don’t think I’m a folk singer. You’ll probably call me a folk singer, but other people know better. (…) I could tell you why I’m a folk singer and explain you why, but you wouldn’t really understand. All you would do is nod your head.” Responding to the journalist when asked if he cared for what he sang: “You got a lot of nerve asking me a question like that, do you ask the Beatles that?” “I’m not questioning you because I don’t expect any answers from you.” These were from a famous Time magazine interview in 65. You can also find a lot of great quotes in his San Francisco press conference from late 1965. I remember that after being confronted by a journalist who was trying to get Dylan to say he was ashamed of his “pop” conversion with Highway 61 Revisited and Bringing it all Back Home, he answered something like “I’m not ashamed, what do you want me to do? Crash the cameras and shout ‘Hallelujah’?”  He used to say about “Tangled up in Blue” in his concerts: “This song took me ten years to live and two years to write.”  And from his songs, I have oh so many. I’ll list some of my favorites. “I don’t think that I’m smart, but I think I can see/ When somebody’s pulling the wool over me/ And if this war comes and death’s all around/ Let me die on this land ’fore I die underground/ Let me die in my footsteps before I go down under the ground” (“Let me Die in my Footsteps) “The line it is drawn, the curse it is cast/ The slow one now will later be fast/ As the present now will later be past/ The order is rapidly fadin’/ And the first one now will later be last/ For the times they are a-changin’” (“The Times They Are A-Changin’”) “Your cracked country lips/ I still wish to kiss/ As to be under the strength of your skin/ Your magnetic movements still capture the minutes I’m in/ But it grieves my heart, love/ To see you’re trying to be a part of/ A world that just don’t exist/ It’s all just a dream, babe/ A vacuum, a scheme, babe/ That sucks you into feeling like this” (“To Ramona”) “A self-ordained professor’s tongue too serious to fool/ Spouted out that liberty is just equality in school/ ‘Equality’, I spoke the word as if a wedding vow/ But I was so much older then, I’m younger than that now” (“My Back Pages”) “Ah, my friends from prison, they ask unto me/ ‘How good, how good does it feel to be free?’/ And I answer them most mysteriously/ ‘Are birds free from the chains of the skyway?’” (“Ballad in Plain D”) “Through the mad mystic hammering of the wild and ripping hail/ The sky cracked its poems in naked wonder/ That the clinging of the church bells blew far into the breeze/ Leaving only bells of lightning and its thunder” (“Chimes of Freedom”) “Through the wild cathedral evening, the rain unraveled tales/ For the disrobed faceless forms of no position/ Tolling for the tongues with no place to bring their thoughts/ All down in taken-for-granted situations/ Tolling for the deaf and blind, tolling for the mute/ Tolling for the mistreated, mateless mother, the mistitled prostitute/ For the misdemeanor outlaw, chased and cheated by pursuit/ And we gazed upon the chimes of freedom flashing” (“Chimes of Freedom”) “She wears an Egyptian ring that sparkles before she speaks/ She’s a hypnotist collector, you are a walking antique” (“She Belongs to Me”) “The bridge at midnight trembles/ The country doctor rambles/ Bankers’ nieces seek perfection, expecting all the gifts that wise men bring/ The wind howls like a hammer/ The night grows cold and rainy/ My love, she’s like some raven at my window with a broken wing” (“Love Minus Zero/No Limit”) “THe cloak and dagger dangles/ Madams light their candles/ In cerimonies of the horsemen, even the pawn must hold a grudge/ Statues made of matchstick crumbling into one another/ My love, she does not bother/ She knows too much to argue or to judge” (“Love Minus Zero/No Limit”) I could use the entirety of “It’s Alright Ma”, but I’m okay mentioning just a few: “Advertising signs, they con you into thinking you’re the one that can do what’s never been done, that can win what’s never been won, meantime life outside goes on all around you” “A question in your nerves is lit, yet you know there is no answer fit to satisfy, insure you not to quit, to keep it in your mind and not forget that it is not he or she or them or it that you belong to” “My eyes collide head-on with stuffed graveyards, false gods, I scuff at pettiness, which plays so rough, walk upside-down inside handcuffs, kick my leg to crash it all and say ‘okay, I’ve had enough, what else can you show me?’ And if my though dreams could be seen, they’d probably put my head in a guillotine” Now others again: “Though you might hear laughing, spinning, swinging madly through the sun/ It’s not aimed at anyone, it’s just escaping on the run/ And but for the skies there are no fences facing/ And if you hear vague traces of skipping wheels of rhyme/ To your tambourine in time, it’s just a ragged clown behind, I wouldn’t pay it any mind/ It’s just a shadow you’re seeing that he’s chasing” (“Mr. Tambourine Man”) “Relationships of ownership, they whisper in the wings/ To those condemned to act accordingly and wait for succeeding kings/ And I try to harmonize with songs, the lonesome sparrow sings/ And there are no kinds inside the gates of Eden” (“Gates of Eden”) “At times I think there are no words but these to tell what’s true/ And there are no truths outside the gates of Eden” (“Gates of Eden”) “Leave your stepping stones behind, something calls for you/ FOrget the dead you’ve left, they will not follow you/ The vagabond who’s rapping at your door/ Is standing on the clothes that you once wore/ Strike another match, go start anew/ And it’s all over now Baby Blue” (“It’s All Over Now, Baby Blue”) “Well, you walk into the room like a camel and then you frown/ You put your eyes in your pocket and your nose on the ground/ There ought to be a law against you coming around/ You should be made to wear earphones” (“Ballad of a Thin Man”) “You’ve been with the professors and they all liked your looks/ With the great lawyers you have discussed lepers and crooks/ You’ve been through all of Scott Fitzgerald’s books/ You’re very well read, it’s well known” (“Ballad of a Thin Man”) “Praise be Nero’s Neptune, the Titanic sails at dawn/ Everybody shouting ‘which side are you on?’/ And Erza Pound and T.S. Elliot, fighting in the captain’s tower/ While calypso singers laugh at them and fishermen hold flowers/ Between the windows of the sea where lovely mermaids flow/ And nobody has to think too much about desolation row” (“Desolation Row”) “Now Ophelia, she’s ’neath the window, for her I feel so afraid/ On her twentieth birthday, she already is an old maid/ To her, death is quite romantic, she wears an iron vest/ Her profession’s her religion, her sin is her lifelessness/ And though her eyes stare upon Noah’s great rainbow,/ She spends her time peeking into desolation row” (“Desolation Row”) “WIth your silhouette when the sunlight dims/ Into your eyes where the moonlight swims/ And your matchbook songs and your gypsy hymns/ Who among them would try to impress you?” (“Sad-Eyed Lady of the Lowlands”) The list is pretty long already, so I’ll shorten it a little. “So sing your praise of progress and of the Doom Machine/ The naked truth is still taboo whenever it can be seen/ Lady Luck, who shines on me, will tell you where I’m at/ I hate myself for loving you, but I should get over that” (“Dirge”) “She opened up a book of poems and handed it to me/ Written by an Italian poet from the thirteenth century/ And every one of the words rang true and glowed like burning coal/ Pouring off of every page, as it was written in my soul from me to you/ Tangled up in blue” (“Tangled up in Blue”) “I noticed at the ceremony your corrupt ways have finally made you blind/ I can’t remember your face anymore, your mouth’s changed, your eyes don’t look into mine/ The priest wore black on the seventh day and sat stone-faced while the building burned/ I waited for you on the running boards, near the cypress trees, while the springtime turned/ Slowly into autumn” (“Idiot Wind”, this is probably my favorite of his entire career) “ ‘Gentlemen’, he said/ ‘I don’t need your organization/ I’ve shined your shoes, I’ve moved your mountains and marked your cards/ But Eden is burning/ Either get ready for elimination/ Or else your hearts must have the courage for the changing of the guards’” (“Changing of the Guards”) “There’s a wall between you and what you want, and you got to leap it/ Tonight you got the power to take it, tomorrow you won’t have the power to keep it” (“The Groom’s Still Waiting at the Altar”) “Well, they’ll choose a man for you to meet tonight/ You’ll play the fool and learn how to walk through doors/ How to enter into the gates of paradise/ Now, how you carry a burden too heavy to be yours/ Yeah, from the stage they’ll be trying to get water outta rocks/ A whore will pass the hat, collect a hundred grand and say thanks/ They like to take all this money from sin, build big universities to study in/ Sing ‘Amazing Grace’ all the way to the Swiss banks” (“Foot of Pride”) “Well, I head that hoot owl singing as they were taking down the tents/ The stars above the barren trees were his only audience/ Them charcoal gypsy maidens can strut their feathers well/ But nobody can sing the blues like Blind Willie McTell” (“Blind Willie McTell”) “They tell me to be discreet for all intended purposes,/ They tell me revenge is sweet, and from where they stand I’m sure it is/ But I feel nothing for their game where beauty goes unrecognized/ All I feel is heat and flame and all I see are dark eyes” (“Dark Eyes”) “Oh the French girl, she’s in paradise and a drunken man is at the wheel/ Hunger pays a heavy price to the fallen gods of speed and steel/ And time is short and the days are sweet, and passion rules the arrow that flies/ A million faces at my feet, but all I see are dark eyes” (“Dark Eyes”) “I was born here and I’ll die here, against my will/ I know it looks like I’m moving, but I’m standing still/ Every nerve in my body feels so vacant and numb/ I can’t even remember what it was I came here to get away from/ Don’t even hear a murmur of a prayer/ It’s not dark yet, but it’s getting there” (“Not Dark Yet”) “They say prayer has the power to help/ So pray from the mother/ In the human heart an evil spirit can dwell/ I’m trying to love my neighbor and do good unto others/ But oh, mother, things ain’t going well” (“Ain’t Talkin’”) “I’ll give you justice, I’ll fatten your purse/ Show me your moral virtues first/ Hear me holler, hear me moan/ I pay in blood, but not my own” (“Pay in Blood”) “On marble slabs and in fields of stone/ You make your humble wishes known/ I touched the garment but the hem was torn/ In Scarlet Town, where I was born” (“Scarlet Town”)  While writing this, I just remembered he wrote some great texts for the textbooks in some of his albums. My favorite is from Bringing it all Back Home, which through most of the text, Dylan freezes time, right after his recording engineer asks him a question. “i have given up at making any attempt at perfection/ the fact that the white house is filled with leaders that’ve never been t the apollo theater amazes me. why allen ginsberg was not chosen t read poetry at the inauguration boggles my mind” “i am convenced that all souls have some superior t deal with/like the school system, an invisible circle of which no one can think without consulting someone/in the face of this, responsibility/security, success mean absolutely nothing” “i would not want t be bach. mozart. tolstoy. joe hill. gertrude sten or james dean/they are all dead. the Great books’ve been written. the Great sayings have all been said” If you want more quotes from his songs, I’d highly suggest the albums Another Side, Bringing it all Back Home, Highway 61 Revisited, Blonde on Blonde, John Wesley Harding, Planet Waves, Blood on the Tracks, Desire, Street Legal, Slow Train Coming, Shot of Love, Infidels, Oh Mercy, Time out of Mind, Love and Theft, Modern Times and Tempest. There are some bootlegs with new songs, too, but you should focus on Bootleg 1–3: Rare and Unreleased.

A few of my favourites : I can't think for you, you'll have to decide You're right from your side & I'm right from mine Don't ask me nothing about nothing, I just might tell you the truth I try my best to be just like I am but everybody wants you to be just like them Don't you understand it's not my problem Don't criticize what you can't understand If my thought dreams could be seen they’d probably put my head in a guillotine Ain’t no use talking to me, it’s just the same as talking to you It is not he or she or them or it that you belong to Everybody must get stoned Let me forget about today until tomorrow You shouldn’t let other people get your kicks for you I wanna be your lover baby I don’t wanna be your boss I march in the parade of liberty, but as long as I love you I'm not free I'll let you be in my dream if I can be in yours Love is just a four letter word I am not asking you to say words like yes or no She knows too much to argue or to judge I never asked for your crutch, now don’t ask for mine Everybody must give something back for something they get Name me someone that’s not a parasite & I’ll go out & say a prayer for him There's no need for anger, there's no need for blame, there’s nothing to prove An I say “Aw c’mon now, you know you know about my debutante.” & she says “Your debutante just knows what you need but I know what you want” Inside the museums infinity goes up on trial He not busy being born is busy dying Don't follow leaders Live by no man’s code To live outside the law you must be honest Sometimes I think this world is just one great big prison yard. Some of us are prisoners, the rest of us are guards. Take what you have gathered from coincidence The answer my friend is blowing in the wind Everybody's shouting “Which side are you on ?” You don’t need a weatherman to know which way the wind blows There’s no left wing & right wing just up wing & down wing I’m trying to get to heaven before they close the door Something is happening here but you don’t know what it is To understand you know too soon there is no sense in trying

People seldom do what they believe in. They do what is convenient, then repent.All I can do is be me, whoever that is.Take care of all your memories. For you cannot relive them.I'll let you be in my dreams if I can be in yours.No one is free, even the birds are chained to the sky.I think of a hero as someone who understands the degree of responsibility that comes with his freedom.Chaos is a friend of mine.Yesterday's just a memory, tomorrow is never what it's supposed to be.Money doesn't talk, it swears.I accept chaos, I'm not sure whether it accepts me.

From ‘some other kinds of songs,’ liner notes from Another Side of Bob Dylan 1964 on what grounds are thegrounds for judgmentan i think alsothat there is not one thing anyplaceanywhere that makes any sensethere are only tearsan' there is only sorrowthere are no problems i have seen what i've lovedslip away an' vanish. I still love what i've lost but t' runan' try t' catch it'd be very greedyfor the rest of my lifei will never chase a livin' soulinto the prison graspof my own self-love i can't believe that i have t’hate anybodyan' when i doit will only be out of fearan' i'll know it ….. jack o'diamondsan' all his crapneeds some acidin his lap

Come mothers and fathersThroughout the landDon't criticizeWhat you can't understandYour sons and your daughtersAre beyond your commandYour old road isRapidly agin'Please get out of the new oneIf you can't lend your handFor your times they are a-changin'....
When you ain’t got nothin, you got nothin to lose You can’t win with a losing hand
Best quotes or best lyrics. Enjoy them all. Dylan art by ed newman
